meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of peristalsis.
meanings.sent1: The peristaltic motion of the intestines helps move food along.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the peristaltic movement of the esophagus is essential for swallowing.
meanings.sent3: The peristaltic dance of the snake charmed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The peristaltic rhythm of the music pulsed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The peristaltic waves in the pool created a mesmerizing pattern.

meanings.sent1: The medication had a peristaltic effect on the patient's digestive system.
meanings.sent2: The peristaltic contractions of the muscles helped push the contents forward.
meanings.sent3: The peristaltic roller coaster ride left everyone feeling dizzy.
meanings.sent4: The peristaltic motion of the crowd resembled a wave at a sports event.
meanings.sent5: The peristaltic movement of the train made the journey feel smooth.
